title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward questions - introduce yourself, explain your interest in the org and the team, why you are qualified, working style, etc. Writing assignment asked to draft an invitation email for a sample event and transcribe a recording.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your working style

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: The first round was rough. There was a written test right after. Talked to a different team for the second and third rounds. Was generally a good experience talking to different people.
Interview Questions: They asked me why CSIS out of all the DC think tanks. Mainly talked about my project experiences and hard skills (e.g., Python, data analysis).

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds + writing test - interviews are straight forward but writing test requires more in depth knowledge of the topic / region. Takes a while to hear back once writing test is submitted
Interview Questions: Why CSIS? Talk about knowledge of [insert region here]

title: Program Coordinator/Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The process had three rounds. Firstly, I had a 15-minute phone screen. The second round was a written test on a potential roundtable and the final round was an hour-long interview.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Invited for a panel interview. Asked about research interests, why CSIS, and details on previous research. One round interview, team members were very welcoming and nice - an overall positive experience
Interview Questions: why CSIS, research interests, and past experience

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was faster than expected, I was interviewed directly by my supervisor, mostly behavioral questions and research interests, and was then given a timed research assessment. Took less than a month.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you initiated something in your previous projects.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy process. I applied online and submitted a cover letter, writing sample, and my resume. They contacted me within a month for the first round interview. I interviewed with 3 people from the team as they took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: If you could experience one event in the last 100 years in (region) what would it be and why?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: One round of interview with the person who would be the manager of the role. Standardized questions, hard to tell what their reaction was. CSIS interviews can be hard as in lack of experience can be a dealbreaker but aren’t as in there isn’t much scope for challenging questions (like technical interviews)
Interview Questions: What’s your familiarity with (relevant languages)?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Quick 30 min max. First applied then you are contacted for a interview, then a writing assessment or social media knowledge assessment . You hear about 2 weeks later if you made it or not
Interview Questions: Why CSIS? Why that focus?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Did an in person interview some time ago. Interview was mostly normal but the head of the program also asked strange questions like if I was married. After the interview there was no follow up and communication was very poor. He left the organization shortly afterward. Gave a bad impression of the organization.
Interview Questions: Are you married? Have you lived in the region?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was very friendly with 3 staff members of the program. They asked the standard questions. The next day I had 24 hours to complete a writing test. After that, I was invited for a final interview with the deputy director of the program. More specific questions to the program were asked. The process gave me a good overall sense of the CSIS.
Interview Questions: Explain a project you have done related to the program- question, method, and results…

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard process. I submitted my cover letter, writing sample, and resume online, and within a week, I was called for an interview. The interview was with two junior staff members, and the questions were as expected. The interview was followed by a 24-hour writing assignment, and within a week, I was accepted. The downside is that I only had 3-4 days to either accept or decline the internship.
Interview Questions: How do you handle competing deadlines? Explain your process.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview process, they only looked at the CV. I was confused as to why I got the job at first, because I have forgotten that I applied. I only received an email that I got the job. The selection process was just a submission of the CV.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
- streamlined and effective
- interesting interviewers that facilitated an insightful interview, allowed me to ask questions as well and were very open about the reality of the position (positive)
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you, academically or professionally, were challenged in your communication and how did you overcome this issue?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Made it to final interview. Which was awful. The interviewer made rude comments and was generally crass. I did not speak much, as it was more of a rant by the interviewer. Was ghosted after the call and not made aware of final decision until I repeatedly emailed to follow up
Interview Questions: Are you a sensitive person, like a “snowflake”?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, asked me about myself, why I am interested in the position, and gave me opportunities to ask questions. Overall it was very standard and not confusing to prepare for.
Interview Questions: Discuss one issue in the field that interests you?

title: Human Rights Associate  Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with several team members, multiple times and spoke with them both on the phone and over video chat for two separate positions. The interview process was fair and extremely helpful.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for our team?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds: 1 with a program assistant, 1 timed research assignment, and 1 with the program director. The whole process took about three weeks. The research project involved me using an hour to research according to a prompt and write up a summary response on my research.
Interview Questions: About previous experiences, communication styles, interest in the program

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by email to do an interview. Pretty standard interview asking about my background. Had to do a skills test after which was more difficult. Took a long time to get a response.
Interview Questions: tell us about your prior experience in this field

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds-- first round with associate director of department (30 mins) and then last round with associate and head of department (1 hour) focused mostly on administrative skills and prior experience supporting upper-level management
Interview Questions: What is the most impactful book you read in the last year.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Had a 30-minute interview that contained mostly behavioral questions and some questions regarding previous research experiences - the overall experience was great and the interviewers were really friendly and nice.
Interview Questions: Past research experiences, academic interests, why CSIS

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Communication was clear, everyone was present as expected and questions were very clear. They offered an opportunity for me to address any questions I had, and overall good interview with the full team.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about us?

title: Spring Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: There was an interview with the assistant and she asked me questions on my resume. Some questions were quite irrelevant to the work the intern has to do.  It was online and not that long with a written test.
Interview Questions:
Q: What did you find interesting about issues in this area?
Q: Why are you interested in this position? Are you trying to do this for your resume?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: An initial 20-min phone-call interview with the program manager and two research associates. The questions are very basic behavioral questions.  And about a week later I was told I couldn't enter the second round interview.
Interview Questions: Only behavioral questions. "What's your biggest weakness and strengths?"

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It went quicker than expected, with mutual introductions, a few questions of the past experience, and some Q&As. I somehow felt a loss of connection between my previous experience in the private sector and CSIS focuses, but surprisingly I got the position.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your past experience? What insights do you get?

title: Audio Production Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Was sent an email asking to have a Zoom interview the next day or the following, so I opted for the following. Very basic questions but pertained to the role/my interests in it/my experience with what the company does. Then I had a second interview with the video production team and they asked about my experience with video production/similar to the questions asked the day before. 

Several business days later I was offered the internship!
Interview Questions: How do you feel conducting yourself amongst experts in fields/world leaders? What projects we work on do you feel passionately about?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of a short (15 minute) phone call with the director of the program, following selection based off of application materials, followed by a written exercise to plan a potential event.
Interview Questions: What previous experiences do you think have most prepared you for this role?

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 stages, a phone call of about 10 to 15 minutes with typical interview questions and then a writing portion where you had to write an event memo with instructions that were given to you.
Interview Questions: Why are  you interested in this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: It was very conversational and you could barely feel you were in an interview. Mostly talked about my cv, talked through my whole experiences. The interviewer made the experience very pleasant.
Interview Questions: please, Tell me about yourself

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Only one round of interviews with associates and fellows of program. Asked for specific area knowledge on my desired area studies position and what topics in particular I was passionate and knowledgeable about
Interview Questions:
Q: How might you apply certain quantitative techniques to this role?
Q: Why CSIS and how might you contribute special skills to this role?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone calls with junior staff, one to go over the position, and one to summarize my experiences. I then had a phone interview with an expert. The expert asked me questions about their research to see if I had done my reading, but didn't ask as much about my background. My experience suggests that experts want people who can quickly integrate into the team and already know the field and their research.
Interview Questions: They asked questions about the field of expertise they specialize in. Make sure you know terms.

title: Summer Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two interviews. The first was with the program coordinator and was a screening call with a few behavioral questions. The second and final interview was with the entire office team and was more technical (questions specific to the office's area of focus)
Interview Questions: Describe a time you worked in a team?

title: Student Access Monitor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and did not require much aside from you talking about your experiences in school and outside of school. I highly recommend applying after the pandemic has ended and when you go back to normal life.
Interview Questions: Why is GWPD a good fit for you?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is informal and non-intimidating. I was informed about my selection for the interview around 15 days after I submitted an application online. The interview lasted for about 20 min and I was intimated about the result in a week.
Interview Questions: Questions about my interests on the topic, one time I failed, etc.

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: About a week after submitting my application online, I was contacted via email asking to schedule an interview. The interview was conducted by phone and it was mainly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my past experience doing research and working with publically available data.

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was quite straightforward with an online application involving just a resume and cover letter. Approximately two weeks later I was contacted for an interview and two weeks after that, I received an offer.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your research process?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Set up over teams, the entire process was good - from scheduling to the meeting quality, I felt comfortable. Lots of questions about my background and focus. Gave good answers about company culture and job details.
Interview Questions: What is your past research history?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions:
- The initial interview was done via Zoom, but audio only. 
- Two interviewers, standard questions about my qualifications, background and interest in the position
- Random language fluency/ability test
Interview Questions: Can you describe the research projects you worked on in your previous job?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were seemingly very nice and younger than I expected. I had an interview for two separate internships, both of which were very different. They both seemed to be more administrative roles with light research, so I'm not sure if they wanted a candidate who had more interest in research or more experience in administration. I felt both interviews went well, but I have not heard back from one of them (I did not get an offer for the other). The questions seemed super basic and straightforward, generally the "why are you interested in this position?" But they really took the time to look through my resume and cover letter and asked questions specific to me, which was actually very nice!
Interview Questions: Q: What interests you about this position?

title: Research, Americas Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application to them and within a few weeks received an email scheduling a phone interview. The questions were not super challenging and dealt more with my academic and professional experiences rather than regional knowledge. I did not receive an offer for a second interview but they informed me that the process going forward would involve another interview and a writing assignment. I asked for feedback on my first interview after not advancing but never heard back.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized and balance multiple projects and priorities?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Program director out to schedule an interview a few days after I submitted my application, and scheduled an interview within the week. The interview took place over the phone. The process was very quick.
Interview Questions: Mostly standard questions about myself and my interest in the position. However, there were also some questions related to my resume and skills which were not related to the internship project or position description.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and got an email to schedule an interview about a week later. Most of the interview questions were related to the department’s subject matter rather than work history.
Interview Questions: Describe experience you’ve had that’s directly related to the department’s programs.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Very long. After I was first offered the interview, I had to complete a skills test. Was only supposed to take two hours yet the complexity of the test demanded a greater amount of time.
Interview Questions: What do you think you will find challenging in this position?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Received an email two days after I submitted my application asking for an interview. Had the interview that same week over Zoom, lasted about 30 minutes. Standard interview questions. I recommend that people applying to a particular region in particular, brush up on current events in the region beforehand that they have reflected on.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at CSIS in particular?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview to go over background and behavioural questions. It lasted an hour and was very pleasant. A second round interview to meet the team and to go over more technical aspects of the job. Questions to gauge research area interest and career goals.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join CSIS and what are your areas of interest for research?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: I was already a CSIS intern, so they internally recruited me; I submitted my application and spoke with the Director for 10 minutes; then was given the job. When hiring internally, it is fairly easy to get a job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the job?

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Austin, TX) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Standard 30 minute phone interview. Questions began with things I had listed on my resume and progressed to questions related to my research experience. No hard-ball or out-there questions were asked, it was all work-related questions. Interviewer was the direct supervisor.
Interview Questions: What kind of research experience do you have?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: After a colleague passed my name along to the hiring manager in one of the CSIS programs, I received a call from the hiring manager asking if I'd like to set up an interview. I did the interview a couple days later, and it was very informal. Connections matter a lot to getting a position at CSIS.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a past research project you've been involved in.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview involved two rounds with the person that I would be replacing and then with the head of the department. It was not super in depth, as the position was mostly about programming and less about actual research.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to manage multiple priorities.

title: External Relations Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The full process was only one interview. The people I spoke to were friendly and easy to make conversation with. The interview was conducted over the phone, and lasted no more than maybe 45 mins -- was probably closer to 30.
Interview Questions: Why CSIS / External Relations?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began with a phone screen, followed by a research assignment. Following the assignment, there was a final round interview. Overall a straightforward and reasonably quick process with no issues.
Interview Questions: What sources do you read to review news on the region?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied via their careers website, was contacted via email, and did a writing interview prior to my in-person interview. A few days after the writing interview, I was called in for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume, cover letter, and transcripts online, and about three weeks later they invited me to do a phone interview. The phone interview was about thirty minutes and I spoke with one of the fellows in the team that I was applying for. The interviewer was very friendly and gave me a lot of helpful information about CSIS in addition to asking me questions. Most of his questions were about my past internship/research experiences and how they were relevant to the work done at CSIS and also why I was interested in working on this team in particular. About a week after my phone interview, they contacted me again to notify me that they had offered the position to another candidate.
Interview Questions: Talk about how your experiences fit this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I sent in my application via the online career portal, we scheduled an initial interview in which the interviewer was flexible about timing, something I appreciated considering the time difference. 

The interview was 15 minutes long, curt, short and to the point. It was conducted by two junior staff members via phone call. The interview gave off a very business-like vibe which was negative in my experience. 

I felt that the lead interviewer did favourably view me from the beginning of the interview with a clear personality clash between us. 

I was really disappointed in the lead interviewer's approach and in what I felt like was a really basic/generic approach to the process. They didn't get to know me nor gave me a chance to get to know them. 

This was confirmed with the generic email I got thanking me for my time, telling me they would not proceed with my application. I did not receive a response to my follow up email, thanking them for their time and respectfully asking for individual feedback. The entire process was disappointing and frankly I am glad I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you applied to the Middle East Research Assistant Position?

title: Summer Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I first applied online. I then received a phone interview a few weeks later. I  heard back with the offer a week or so after that then promptly accepted the position and went through the onboarding process.
Interview Questions: - Describe your qualitative and quantitative research experience.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application, which was followed by a panel interview. The interview lasted about 40 - 45 minutes. The interviewers provided background on the internship/research projects. The questions were fairly standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you've had to carry out a research project. What sources did you use? What were your findings.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Short phone call discussing my interest in the position and related work experience. The interviewer seemed to be on a tight schedule so I wasn’t able to ask many questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email to sent up a time for a phone interview the next week. A week later, I got another email inviting me to join the second round of interviews, either in-person or through video conferencing.
Interview Questions: What are the two most important policy issues in the world today in your opinion?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online from an employee referral. Minimal questions in initial interview outside of the standard. Overall an easy conversation but the person seemed a bit disinterested. Took maybe 20 mins and had no follow up.
Interview Questions: About past experience

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were two parts to the interview. The first was standard questions. It was about 30 minutes. Second, involved doing some work to show what I could do. I had 30 minutes to complete the assignment.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this position?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview about 3-4 days after applying online. After interview, the screener told me she would be in touch within a few days. Never heard back from her. I sent a follow up email and still heard nothing back.
Interview Questions: Why do you think this internship would be a good step in your career?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: I had a preliminary interview with the program manager on the phone, then was asked to do a writing assignment, and then had an interview with the director of the program. The questions were mostly straightforward interview questions, and the interviewers were friendly.
Interview Questions: What local sources do you read from the Middle East?

title: Middle East Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the necessary materials, they emailed to request a phone interview. We had a good fifteen minute conversation, wherein they asked me basic questions about myself and things pertinent to the Middle East. They then requested an additional writing sample that focused on the Middle East. I dropped out of the process soon thereafter, but it was a great process.
Interview Questions: How do you think the (then-)recent Khashoggi killing will affect Saudi Arabia?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward interview assessing my suitability for the role, prior experience and compatibility with the team.  I was their first interview, so the questions were a bit disjointed, but otherwise a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone interview, which was easier than I expected; the person interviewing me was very pleasant and nice, so it was not stressful at all. they first explained me what this job is all about, what they expect from an intern, then asked me some questions, and then asked me if i have any questions. I asked about the stipend, for its a reasonable concern to have, but a person did not have an answer what they pay their interns, which was kind of upsetting
Interview Questions: the questions were pretty general and typical, e.g. why do you want to work here, what is the biggest challenge you have faced, and where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Digital Publishing and Publications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: First was sent a copyediting test to complete, then was brought into the office for an interview with the person leaving the position and the person the position reports to.  While both the people were nice, I waited for them to come get me for over 20 minutes past the time we were scheduled to meet, and I had gotten there early, too. Extremely unprofessional in that regard.
Interview Questions: They hardly asked about my experience, mostly just wanted to know what questions I had for them.

title: Program Coordinator/Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Contacted a couple of weeks after submitting application. Had a phone interview with standard questions. The interviewer (senior fellow) seemed disinterested in a genuine exchange -- was very business like. Never heard back despite two follow-ups. Think the issue was mainly that I didn't work on the specific subtopic she was looking to expand in her program, as she made somewhat clear.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience at X organization.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an email requesting a writing sample and then set up a phone interview a couple of days later. the phone interview was with the head of the program who spent a lot of time reviewing the responsibilities for the position and then asked to expand on previous experience in research and administrative work
Interview Questions: What's your experience handling big projects that involve coordinating with other departments?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an interview 2 weeks later in person. The interview was conducted by two persons. They introduced the departments, duties and daily schedules first.The questions are fair, but some are not shown as I saw on Glassdoors.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and challenges

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview with some junior staffers, then an in-person interview with the director, then a panel interview with multiple employees, and then a final interview with the team I'd be joining. The process moved quickly and they were clear about what was expected at each step. There was also a writing test, which was very straight forward.
Interview Questions: How do you see this position fitting into your larger career goals?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then was called in for an interview. After the first round, I had a phone interview with the Deputy Director of the program. They asked high-level questions and are interested in your opinion and academic background.
Interview Questions: They asked me about current events and foreign policy questions

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: They got back to me in two days. I submitted the application online and received an email to schedule an interview the same week.  The interview itself was like any normal interview. They did take a lot of time explaining the position and the responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and two weeks later received an email asking me to do a phone interview the next day.  The first interview was with two employees and lasted 30 minutes.  They asked me mostly about my resume and my interest in the specifics of the position.  There were a couple difficult questions where they asked me about what they saw as gaps in my experience.  The next day, I was asked to do a second phone interview with the program director.  That interview lasted 20 minutes and was easier and more conversational.  I was then asked to do a short timed writing assignment.  Three days after submitting that, I received my offer.

A good portion of the interview time was allotted to me asking questions, so have a long list of good followup questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working with CSIS in particular?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions: You apply through the online portal, but are unlikely to get anywhere unless you can get someone in the building to flag your application and put a word in.
Interview Questions: What historical figure would you not want to be?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: After applying online I received an email reaching out to set up a phone interview. The interview was cancelled via email shortly before it was supposed to begin, and the interviewer requested an alternate time to speak. I never heard from the interviewer again.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted initial application (resume, cover letter, recs) in response to a posting. One week later a phone interview was scheduled, with basic questions regarding fit, qualifications, etc. One week after that, a final on-site interview was scheduled with a member of the team with which I would potentially work. First, the interviewer provided a rundown of their team, work, and related needs. Second, a large amount of time was devoted to soliciting and answering questions from the interviewee, regarding both the team & its substantive work and the organization and culture of CSIS more broadly, with the apparent goal of both 1. providing information and 2. assessing fit & expertise based on questions asked. Finally, a very small amount of time was devoted to asking a more traditional interview question (namely, that I run through my resume and connect it to the job's requirements), followed by one other question (listed below) geared toward seeing the interviewee walk through a cost benefit analysis out loud.

**IMPORTANT NOTE: Based on many conversations, there is a large variance in interview style and content at CSIS, a function of differences across programs/projects/teams as well as the large amount of personal discretion afforded to the interviewer.

**Resultant Advice: Come prepared for questions typical of both a traditional job interview and a behavioral interview, and also be ready to illustrate analytic and research processes out loud as well as be at least somewhat apprised of current events. And be prepared to ask good questions!
Interview Questions: Of the several projects we've discussed, to which of them would you/your skillset add the most value and why, comparatively?

title: Video Editor/Multimedia Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Jan 2017

I got along well with everyone I met and was told that I did not need to know motion graphics for the job. I was told that interns come in not knowing motion graphics and a month later they were proficient. They told me they had no problem teaching me how to use motion graphics. Then a month later they told me they could not hire me because I did not know motion graphics.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with someone higher up and not in your department telling you that you need to redo your entire project?

title: Intern Interview

Took about two weeks before I received an invitation for a second round group interview. The panel was made up of the same mid-level employee, plus an entry-level employee and an intern. The presence of the current intern was very helpful, as I could ask them directly about their responsibilities, the general work culture, etc.
Interview Questions: How does this position fit into your long term goals?

title: Software Engineer(Internship) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Baton Rouge, LA) in Jan 2017

Interview Questions: How do you plan to impact the company?

title: Intern Interview

title: Intern Interview

title: Web Interview

title: Intern Interview

title: Research Interview

title: Research Interview

title: Intern Interview

title: Intern Interview

title: Intern-Burke Chair In Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted my application via the website, was contacted about two months later by the program manager. (It had actually been so long that I accepted an offer somewhere else, but CSIS was by far my top choice, so had to go back and withdraw from the other place.) 

Had one in person interview which was fairly standard-tell me about yourself, your interest in CSIS, your interest in the Burke Chair, etc, and then a few analytic questions. 

1. tell me about a region of strategic interest to the US, and explain why its strategic and what we're doing there. 

This was April 2013, so I talked about the deployment of THAAD missiles to Alaska in response to aggressive NK posturing. 

2. If i gave you a report on the Iranian nuclear program and asked you to update it, how would you did that. 

Talked about evaluating developments at nuclear sites, impact of sanctions, upcoming summer 2013 elections, etc.
Interview Questions: tell me about a region of strategic interest to the US, and explain why its strategic and what we're doing there.

title: Intern Interview

Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a phone interview after a friend forwarded along my resume. They asked a lot of straightforward questions about my experience and what I gained from them. They also asked some behavioral questions like 'how do you deal with high pressure situations and a lot of things being thrown at you?'
Interview Questions: How do you think organizations can use social media to their benefit?

title: Research Intern Interview

title: Intern Interview

Interview Questions: What is your relevant Experience?

title: Internship Interview

I did, and emailed her like 5 months later. I had the informational interview, it went well. I later emailed her in may and asked her to review my cover letter for the internship application. She immediately told me she needed an intern I was interviewed over the phone on Friday and got the position on Monday.
Interview Questions: Is this the kind of work you would be interested in doing?

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: qualitative questions on current affairs, make sure you have opinions on topical issues. Be prepared to talk about your research and writing skills as well as administrative experience. Any answer is better than saying you don't know.
Interview Questions: What do you think about the current state of country X's relationship with the United States?

title: Summer Intern Interview

Interview Descriptions: Few weeks after I applied for the summer internship program online, I got an email to schedule a phone interview. The interview was a conference call with me and two mid-level staff persons. It was a typical interview to talk about why you are interested, what makes you a good candidate, etc. They also provided good answers to the questions I had about the company. The interview was informal, relaxed, and friendly.
Interview Questions: How did you become interested in our work?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Center for Strategic and International Studies (Washington, DC) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions:
I sent in my resume and cover letter, and heard back two weeks later. (The announcement had been up on the site for a week or two before I sent in my materials.) It was right around Christmas time, so the timeline might be skewed from their normal process.

The staffer doing the hiring asked for three writing samples, which I sent along via email. I never heard back from the organization after sending these in.

I have been told by a friend who works at the Center that the organization has been getting upwards of 500 applications per position for many of their research assistant positions, and that many of these have been filled without announcements or by moving up interns or bringing back former interns. Hard place to get into, at least if you haven't done the internship first.
Interview Questions: Submit three writing samples.
